AbstractText.sentence: Escherichia coli integration host factor (IHF) is a DNA-binding protein that participates in gene regulation, site-specific recombination, and other processes in E. coli and some of its bacteriophages and plasmids.

AbstractText.sentence: In the present study, we showed that IHF is a direct negative effector of the ompB operon of E. coli.
Gel retardation experiments and DNase I footprinting studies revealed that IHF binds to three sites in the ompB promoter region.
